meanings.definition: Easily excited to irritation or anger.
meanings.sent1: The hyperirritable child quickly became upset when his toy broke.
meanings.sent2: She is known to be hyperirritable when she is hungry.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritable cat got annoyed when the doorbell rang.
meanings.sent4: His hyperirritable nature turned him into a ticking time bomb.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritable dog barked at every passing car.

meanings.sent1: The hyperirritable skin reacted strongly to the new lotion.
meanings.sent2: She is hyperirritable to loud noises due to her condition.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritable flower wilted at the slightest touch.
meanings.sent4: His hyperirritable taste buds could detect the slightest change in flavor.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritable baby cried at the gentlest touch.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an abnormally heightened response to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The hyperirritable nerves caused him to jump at the smallest sound.
meanings.sent2: She has a hyperirritable reaction to certain foods.
meanings.sent3: The hyperirritable alarm clock woke him up with a start.
meanings.sent4: His hyperirritable reflexes made him dodge the ball effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The hyperirritable plant grew rapidly in response to sunlight.
